Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous254
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides nice amenities for business travelers. The Internet access is good, the rooms are clean and in good repair and the breakfast proveds a good start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay”
Reviews.Author: whosyer12
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 14+ day stay here. Would give this 3 1/2 stars if I could---but can't give it 4. We chose this hotel based on the sterling reviews from this sight + the decent discounted rate we were able to get. For the most part we weren't disappointed. We stayed her in March 2012 during spring training. The hotel is across the street (within walking distance) from the Angels stadium and training facility. During the week--this was a pretty well run facility---but on weekends, thronged with baseball fans, it was a different story. Elevators and their foyers were left disgustingly dirty, despite the front desk staff being advised of the problem. Hallways were filthy. Housekeeping services were very disorganized. The whole place from management to maintenance--just didn't seem to give a darn. Even during the week there were some flaws: the pool & spa (that I witnessed) were only cleaned once a week--on Mondays. Pool towels were a crapshoot ---some days they were supplied--others not. The exercise room had a nice towel rack and water cooler ---but never during our stay were towels or cups available. Housekeeping was a guessing game---early in our stay they consistently arrived during the afternoons ---while we were out---perfect! Then mid stay they started inquiring if we "needed anything" fairly early in the mornings--then toward the end of the stay--once, they didn't show at all- and two other occasions--we felt they wouldn't have shown had we not complained to the front desk---after 5PM. The no shows and lates were, again, on the weekend. Hate to seem so negative. Overall it was a pretty decent place. Well located to the freeway system---friendly front desk and hospitality staff. Given the reviews here though--I'd have to say we were slightly disappointed. We'd probably stay here again--but might look for a Spring Training base that wasn't so close to a stadium. Some tips if staying here: there are only two TINY wastebaskets for the entire two room suite. Bring a few larger trashbags , particularly for the kitchen. The pool is not designed for sun worshipers. At least in March --only a small portion of the pool has any sun until later in the day.---stake out your sunspot early!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: chubmasterp
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms and lobbies. Clean. Quick checkin . Attentive staff and pleasant evening reception.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for Cotten Center visitors”
Reviews.Author: jaf006
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice this year (2012), 2 weeks each stay. It is at the eastern end of the Cotten Center Business Park, and is close to PHX. The hotel is fairly new (don't know the actual opening date) and still is "shiney". My experiences with the staff were all very positive, especially Dorothy for the evening meal and Bizarre at the front desk. The fitness room is probably the best I've seen in a hotel, bright and airy with a view out to the pool. My first stay my room was a handicap room. My only complaint with that room was the shower. It did not have any sort of shower curtain or door, so the water would run out into the bathroom area. I had to use an extra towel in addition to the shower mat to prevent that. Since this shower is wheel chair accessable, I don't know what could be done. Other than that, both rooms I had were fine. Although you have a full kitchen, you probably won't need it Monday through Thursday. The evening meals are pretty good. If you do choose to dine out, local options are limited. There are several fast food establishments around the corner, but no Chili's/BJ's/Texas Roadhouse type places in the immediate area, let alone "fine dining". You will have to drive 15 minutes or so to upgrade your dining choices. My only complaint about the hotel itself is that I can't get back into it for a trip in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to airport, good value”
Reviews.Author: Gertilda M
Reviews.Content: Booked for a business trip. I was very happy with the room and the staff. The breakfast was pretty standard. My company had booked several meeting rooms for the week, they had some problems with regulating the temperature in the conference rooms. All week it was either too hot or freezing cold. They also catered breakfast for the group (both for out of town and in-town participants) and the catered breakfast was not particularly good: pastries were stale, only got fruit on one day, etc., I was glad I was staying in the hotel to take advantage of the regular breakfast. The pool was closed for maintenance or repair during my stay so I did not get to try it. The fitness center was adequate but did not seem to have climate control, was hot and steamy even first thing in the morning, and did not have towels available. Overall good value for the standard hotel items (room and staff), only "OK" for the extras I look for in a hotel: breakfast, pool, fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: BC97
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Homewood Suites on the last couple of days in January 2012 and had a pleasant experience. The hotel is close to the airport and located in a business district, but also not far from ASU. I booked this hotel through my corporate travel and was surprised to see that all the room types were the same price, so I booked the presidential style suite thinking that it was probably a mistake. Well, it wasn't. I asked the gentleman at the front desk if I really got that suite and he said yes. Check-in was easy and the front desk staff were very nice. Housekeeping also did an excellent job and the staff in the dining room were helpful and kind. I was assigned to room 325 which is also equipped for guests with disabilities. So the counters were lower, there was a walk-in shower, etc. All the front doors to the rooms look charming. Upon entering the room, I was wowed by the size. I'd guess it's about 1000 square feet or so. There's a kitchen, dining area, large living room, separate bedroom with a sitting area and a large bathroom. Then there's a balcony with a view of the pool and a view of the mountains to the north. The kitchen is fully equipped with a full refrigerator, sink with disposal, flat top stove, plenty of cabinet space and a pantry. The counter tops are granite and there's a large pass through bar from the kitchen to the dining area with three bar stools. The dining area isn't walled off, but rather some space between the kitchen and living room with a table that seats 6. Off to the side is a work desk with a comfortable chair, phone and wired internet (wireless is also available in the hotel) for free. The living room has a sofa, loveseat, ottoman, and a 42" LG LCD TV mounted over the gas fireplace. There's a glass door that opens to the large balcony that wraps around to the bedroom with another door. The living room and bedroom have separate thermostats. The bedroom is also very large with a king bed and a sitting area with two chairs. There's another work desk in the bedroom with another internet jack. The closet in the bedroom is average size. There's a chest of drawers and another 42" LCD TV mounted on the wall. The bathroom is huge with two sinks, granite counter tops, plenty of drawer space, a 32" LCD TV mounted over the Jacuzzi tub, and a walk-in shower. It was really nice to pull out the TV to watch while getting ready in the morning. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast and 'dinner' in the dining area adjacent to the lobby. The breakfast includes hot foods such as waffles, etc., or pastries, cereal, juice and so on. The buffet dinner varies. The night I was there they had some pastas. And they include free bottled beer, soda and water for guests. Any of this can be taken back to the room. The hours are limited and the hotel does not offer made to order entrees or room service. There's a pool and a very large hot tube in the center of the hotel. They also have a fitness room, but I didn't use to to rate it. The drawbacks I found were very minor. The high speed internet isn't very fast. I used the wired internet because I was getting about double the speed of the wireless, but the best I could get was about 0.4 mbps download speed the evening that I tried it. Contrast that with 5.5 mbps I get on my 3G phone. As I mentioned earlier, the hotel is located in a business area which was within walking distance to my office. But there are very few restaurants nearby (mostly fast food). I ended up dining over by the university which was about a 10-15 minute drive. I tried out the Jacuzzi tub in this particular suite and wasn't impressed. The jets barely made bubbles and the tub itself wasn't very comfortable. All in all, I really enjoyed my stay and will definitely stay here again when I return on business. Unfortunately, with my first visit being in a presidential style suite, the future visits may seem disappointing by comparison.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels i have stayed in for the money”
Reviews.Author: docshane
Reviews.Content: The best staff i have ever encountered in a hotel. The food was great for both meals offered. Our two bedroon suite was awesome for 7 of us and was clean. For the money we paid the value was beyond excellent. Would stay here again without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: flapjack5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here using points, service was excellent, employees were all very friendly and went the extra mile to help; rooms were clean and comfortable, and breakfast was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Also nice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: psce
Reviews.Content: We recently rented three rooms for one night and were pleasanlty impressed at every turn. Although designed for long term business occupation our one night stay let us experience free airport transfers, 2 meals, friendly staff and a newer clean room with comfortable bed. Although the dinner and breakfast menu are not exensive (included with room rate) the people were very friendly, accomidating and the facility was extremely clean. Our rooms all included a living area, kitchenette, bedroom, bath and large patio area. The rate for a single night was slightly higher but with the meals, airport transfers and room size the rate was very fair. Would stay again in if in town.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff need lesson in etiquette and customer service”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTreehugger
Reviews.Content: Would have given this beautiful hotel five stars and a big excellent rating if not for first impressions. Staff needs to be able to read people after a long trip and give 100% attention when people arrive. No side conversations. Example "what does this mean?" several times by young lady processing my reservation on the computer to "Stephen" who then "fixed" whatever issues she was having without explanation. He then ran my card and scared the daylights out of me by telling me my card declined. Worried that someone hacked my info and stole my identity as I had been traveling. Mind you this was for a one night stay. Hubby to the rescue. Sorry his card declined also. You may need to call your bank! OMG! Call the bank which was fortunately still open and spend 10 minutes with what I thought was a three way converstion until I realized hotel staff was not listening to me at all. Bank says plenty of money. Finally they ran it through again and it went through.Must be a problem with the computer! Too late, damage done, holds on both accounts now and then Steven asks if I want him to talk to the bank? HUH? No thanks, you both have been very unsympathetic and I am tired, frustated embarrased, but will talk to a manager as I am considering leaving. Manager comes and says he's sorry.I am not impressed. Hubby convinces me to stay. Otherwise: Managers reception was very nice, includes beer and wine. Front desk staff should take notice of hostess Dorothy, genuinely nice, hard working, friendly and very efficient. Same with hostess in morning (didn't catch her name) , real gems. Food very good, both breakfast and dinner, 24 hour coffee, reception area large, good flow, good selections. Rooms spacious, clean, great beds, flat screen TV's. Pool area small but nice, large spa. Large patio area with BBQ's. Hotel 100 % non smoking which I understand but still drives me nuts, can't there be 10 feet of an area outside away from everything for smoking so that smokers can be polite and not offensive? I saw smokers out front and on the patio "sneaking" a cigarette like high school, and there were ashtrays sitting there. I just don't get it. Especially for an extended stay. No airport shuttle before 6am but hotel will comp the cab which ran about S12.00 USD. Not really near anything in walking distance that I could tell and the surrounding area is maybe not the best, but really no reason to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Fotogeeks
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely place to stay after flying in from the UK. It was close to the airport but not too close to be bothered by noise from the planes. In fact, we didn't hear any noise at all from anyone else for the two nights that we stayed there. We had stayed at another Hilton Suites on a previous trip to the USA and were pleasantly surprised to have the exact same room at this one, so they must be standard throughout the chain. Lovely big room with a big, comfortable bed. Fully equipped kitchen if required. The only downside was the complimentary hot breakfast. It wasn't very hot. The 'hot' water for tea was tepid. Having been to the USA on many holidays previously, I was prepared for this so it is only a minor gripe. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Such a fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: bjcseven
Reviews.Content: I have spent quite a bit of time in the area and this property is second to none to anywhere I have stayed in the country. The breakfast and evening food provided is such a great luxury to have. Everything is very clean, the rooms are huge and the staff is always willing to go the extra mile if you need anything. With a locaton just across the street from Tempe Diablo Stadium this is the perfect place to stay for Angels Spring Training!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and staff”
Reviews.Author: Familytravel15
Reviews.Content: Not only was our room priced right but the level of service was outstanding. The entire staff made us feel welcome and at home. We will definitely revisit this hotel when we return to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is Great - Call First About the Airport Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: 2eratics
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property on two occasions as the "anchor" for our SW USA road trip. We used it as our arrival and departure hotel in Phoenix. We selected it based on TA reviews and were not disappointed. The room, pool/spa and staff were great. We got the impression the hotel was so new the staff were still in the learning phase as upon arrival there was some confusion about using HH points (both times). The breakfast was substantial and even at 4 AM there was fresh hot coffee. The best part of this property is the pool. When you arrive in Phoenix at 10:30 PM and it is still 100 degrees, that pool sure is nice. Since we just used the hotel for arrival from and departure to the airport, we cannot comment as to what is nearby except a few fast food places. One item to note though: the hotel shuttle does not operate after 9PM. Call the hotel from the airport as we did and they will provide instructions on taking and being reimbursed for using a local cab.

Reviews.Title: “Great newer hotel”
Reviews.Author: fit4life2B
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at this property before an early morning flight out of Sky Harbor. It was very convenient to be close to the airport. Took approx. 15minutes to arrive at Rental car return. Wish we could've stayed longer. It was a nice change after having spent the previous 3 nights at Grand canyon lodging(Yavapai Lodge). After being cramped in the motel type lodging, it was a luxury to have a separate bedroom, sitting area, kitchen & balcony. It was immaculate & looked so new. We used the pool & hottub that evening. The size of the pool was adequate & the hottub was pretty large. The pool area was comfortable with a few chairs & loungers. There were smokers under the pavillion which is located by the pool area. Not sure if this was truly a designated smoking area. Thought it was a smoke free property. There were guest luandry rooms on our floor which was also a good ammenity offered. W/D was $1.50 each. Dryer ate up my coins & never did start but front desk staff immediately reimbursed me. Just used the 2nd dryer in the room. They also had a wheeled laundry cart available for use so you didn't have to use your suitcase or bags to transport your laundry. There were plenty of parking spaces. Also, many choices of restaurants around the hotel. We didn't have the evening manager's reception since we stayed over a weekend. Missed the free breakfast because of catching a very early flight. So can't comment on these. We enjoyed staying here even though for only 1 night. Would recommend if staying in Phoenix especially if needing to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay and service by staff...”
Reviews.Author: tammara92691
Reviews.Content: I was in town for Connie Mack Baseball Tournament at Diablo Stadium right across the street. (My son and his teammates were at another hotel in town.) Everything during my stay was perfect. The room was great and the entire hotel was beautifully designed. The staff went out of there way to extend their services. The pool area was great and the BBQ around pool was a great touch. You do need to put out a few lounge chairs however or add a few more chairs around the pool. I loved the dinner and drinks and the hostess on 7/27 and 7/28 was fantastic. I did not catch her name. Front desk staff, Titus, and the night clerk on 7/29 went out of his way to help me with a problem I had. Kudus to the entire staff. This was the fifth Hilton property I have stayed at this summer and was probably the best experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: scoobychups
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a whirlwind trip around the Phoenix, Grand Canyon and Sedona areas of Arizona. We spent 4 nights here at the beginning of our trip. We had a two bedroom suite that slept two families of 4. We were all raving about this place. From the comfy beds, the breakfasts and evening reception on weekdays, guest laundry, the pool, the cleanliness and friendly service, it was a perfect choice for our families. The only issues we had were that one morning breakfast was temporarily unavailable because they had a big group all eat at once but after a bit of a wait things were replenished. Also, apparently the sofa bed could have been comfier. I'm not sure that would be any different elsewhere. We even stayed at a fancier, resort property for the last 2 days of our trip with the thinking that our kids would enjoy all the water park amenities but in the end, we decided that they would have had just as much fun in the pool here and we would have had much better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Angels spring training”
Reviews.Author: MMorton
Reviews.Content: Extended family including 8 adults enjoyed this hotel while on our trip to enjoy Angels spring training in Tempe. Ballpark is across the street - a hike, but with traffic on game days, very doable. Hotel is new, rooms clean and large, kitchen comes with DW but would rather have had an oven, pool area is nice, two gas grills on premises. We particularly enjoyed the breakfast each morning, although the staff is sometimes overwhelmed at breakfast when the hotel is full. Several fast food restaurants very close to hotel. Absolutely will use this same hotel next year for Angels baseball!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cstrom
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! Very clean. The room was HUGE! Free breakfast and dinner every day. I will definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New and Ultra Modern”
Reviews.Author: Saluga
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by this hotel as soon as we walked into the lobby. It was very sleek and modern and completely different than any other Homewood Suites that we stayed at. The hotel appeared to be new, and our room looked as if we were one of the first guests to occupy it. It was a very spacious studio suite with a full kitchen, dining table, living area and king bed. The sink and vanity in the bathroom was separated by a door from the tub and toilet. The fitness room and business center were enclosed with glass, and the hallways were very wide, giving the hotel an open and airy feeling. Outside, by the pool, there was a pavilion and a patio with tables and chairs. Since we were there on a weekend night, we didn’t sample the complimentary light meal that’s served on weeknights, nor did we try the free breakfast, as we had to catch an early flight. The hotel is located in an industrial area, but there are plenty of eateries nearby, and the airport is just a short distance away.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but could use some attention.”
Reviews.Author: TomT_9
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at Homewood Suites for business. I've had some mediocre experiences and some very good ones. This particular one was not up to par with some of the others. The facilities and rooms are clean, and the rooms quiet...no complaints there. Mostly minor stuff. Iron was missing from room. Only one TV remote, but it did control both TVs, so just a minor annoyance in having to carry it back and forth between the room and living area. No wine or beer in the evening reception (they say they are "close" to getting their license). They have a TV in the reception area, but might as well not as their "mood music" drowns it out. As a Silver Hilton Honors member (not very high up, I know), it still miffed me that they wouldn't allow me a late checkout (8pm) even though I offered to pay half the daily rate. The hotel wasn't packed out, so it doesn't make much business sense to let a room go vacant when you could at least realize a partial payment AND satisfy a loyal customer. I think with a little more attention to the little things, this facility could be one of the better ones, but if I was going back again in the near future I might try a different Homewood.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: CarolEPBayarea_CA
Reviews.Content: I rated this place 29 out of 30 points possible even though there was a slight, irritating snag at the beginning - they aren't listed on the hotel shuttle numbers at the airport, for one thing, and for another, when I called another Phx area Homewood Suite and they tried to connect me, we did this three times and they never answered the phone! When I got there (after taking a taxi - note: taking any taxi from the airport is a minimum charge of $16.00, no matter how short a distance you're going - the cabbie said it was legislation, see the sticker on the window...) the guy at the desk said he'd tried to answer the phone but there was nobody at the other end. Phone problems, I guess. Still, I rated them very highly because the room was very comfortable, very clean, and very nice - little well-equipped kitchen, pretty furnishings, and lovely comfy bed. They have FREE internet access in the business center (I hate lugging a laptop with me) and those good free Homewood Suites breakfasts with actually good coffee and decent eggs and other real breakfast stuff...almost anything you could want. M-Th they have a happy hour with pretty good (especially for free) food and offer wine. Staff were outstanding - everyone, the housekeeping staff, the driver of the shuttle, the people who tend the meals - everyone! Helpful, personable, accommodating. They have the little convenience store there and I went to buy deodorant because I'd forgotten mine - the woman at the desk stopped me and handed me a complimentary one instead! They have a great, if small, but very well equipped gym, and a lovely pool and spa - actually big enough for more than 4-5 people at a time and shaped so you could snuggle with your sweetie and still be somewhat private from the other snuggling couples...and they pipe in nice music. They even have a laundry room where you can do yours. Little touches like fresh fruit at the front desk instead of those under-baked kinda icky-sweet cookies they have at other hotels. The only point off I gave them was location - and that only because it's kind of an industrial/business area, not much of any place to walk to in the evening or mornings. But convenient to the airport, especially with the shuttle. They are my first choice if/when I go to Phoenix on business.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Experience at the Homewood Suites PHX”
Reviews.Author: Pokymike
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nearly new (< 1 yr. old). Suites are spacious with large flat panel TVs. Amenities are numerous, the best being shuttle service to the airport and local points of interest, like the Mill Av area near the ASU campus. There are several fast food places within a 5 minute walk (Panda Express, Whataburger, Pizza Hut) as well as a convenient store. A supermarket with liquor (Fry's) is about a half hour round trip walk, or take the shuttle. Staff welcoming and accomadating. Free parking. I would definitely return there; the location seems very good for a spring training baseball stay with one stadium (Tempe Diablo) right across 48th St. Did not use the pool and spa facilities, buth they looked inviting, and I think the pool was heated in Nov.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Homewood Suites!”
Reviews.Author: robfromalberta
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for four nights ( Nov 13 - 16 ) and had a great experience throughout our stay there. We chose to stay here because of its central location for our sporting event, shopping and sightseeing needs. If you have ever stayed in a newer Homewood Suites this one will not disappoint you. Abundant free parking, HDTV, friendly and accomodating staff, nice hot tub and a very warm heated pool for the winter months. The property was clean and well maintained. In addition to all that Homewood Suites offer I would recommend this place to anyone staying in this area of Phoenix.

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites Phoenix Airport South
HotelInfo.Address: 4750 East Cotton Center Blvd, Phoenix, AZ 85040
